intro: Stenogyne oxyodonta, commonly known as the Hawaiian skyflower, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically bloom in clusters. The plant has a compact growth habit with hairy stems and leaves that are often glandular. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in mesic forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
